intro: Nemorsoa quinquefolia, commonly known as the five-leaved mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves, which typically have five leaflets, giving it its scientific name. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within its native habitat.
